Certain Writs And Proceedings In Special Cases
Writs Of Error, Vacating Judgment, Writs Of Review

law.catch_line: Convictions; Effect Of Age On Validity
law.text: Upon a proceeding to reverse or avoid a conviction of crime or to obtain the discharge of a person who is held in custody thereunder, the fact that the person was under the age of seventeen at the time of the conviction shall not affect the validity of the conviction nor entitle the person to be discharged.
